descript.abstract: A Planned Unit Development (PUD) is a large-scale development in which conventional zoning standards (such assetbacks and height limits) are relaxed in order to conserve sensitive areas, promote the creation of public amenities such as parks and plazas, and encourage the mixing of different land uses. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters. This layer contains complete theoretical address ranges. METADATA CONTENT IS IN PROCESS OF VALIDATION AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE.
descript.purpose: This data set was created to act as a basis for public and private institutions to improve their policy and decision making; promote economic development; and enhance the quality of life for residents and businesses.

idinfo.accconst: Contact OCTO GIS. Any data obtained outside of OCTO GIS or the DC Office of Zoning are unauthorized copies.
idinfo.datacred: District of Columbia Office of Zoning (DCOZ)
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 4; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.6.1500

attracc.attraccr: Data believed to be complete and accurate, subject to change. Digital version compared with original source data for accuracy and completeness. Validated by source and/or responsible agency.

dataqual.logic: Data is updated by Data Coordinator and QC'ed by the Chief Technology Officer.
dataqual.complete: Data believed to be complete and accurate, subject to change. Digital version compared with original source data for accuracy and completeness. Validated by source and/or responsible agency.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal accuracy based on DC GIS Real Property Data
